results.title: Fever pitch
results.creator_credit: David Evans, Amanda Posey and Wildgaze Films
results.brief_description: Paul Ashworth discovers his passion for soccer when he accompanies his father to an Arsenal game. 24 years later, he still has the same passion, and is an unorthodox, deeply pessimistic thirty something English teacher. The highs and lows of Arsenal’s performance mirrors that in Paul’s personal life, thus the two worlds intermingle. Enter Sarah, and a relationship develops between two people that think the other one is either uptight or a soccer lout. As their relationship develops, Paul must question the distinction and importance between his personal life and his sporting fanaticism, as he is faced with the choice of deciding between following Arsenal’s first chance to win the championship in 18 years, or to pursue love. Cast includes Colin Firth, Ruth Gemmell, Neil Pearson and Lorraine Ashbourne. Based on the novel by Nick Hornby.

results.title: Reasons for caring
results.creator_credit: Craig Johnson and National Fire Protection Association (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Following an explosion in an operating theatre, various people comment on the possibilities of fire in a hospital, the precautions to take and the potential for tragedy if a fire does occur. No matter why a fire starts, staff should know exactly what to do and where equipment is stored.

results.title: Feathers, fur or fins
results.brief_description: This delightful children’s program is a compilation of different episodes from the popular “Playmates” television series screened on the ABC, and it explores a wide range of Australian animals through songs and looking at animals. Contains some animated sequences.

results.title: Festival express
results.creator_credit: Bob Smeaton, John Trapman, Gavin Poolman, Peachtree Films and Apollo Films
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1970, two Canadian music promoters decided to put on a touring music festival. Instead of the artists meeting at each location, they put everyone on a train that went from city to city. What a ride! This documentary is a re-discovery of the musical journey that took place and for some the great emotional journey from the vibe and friendship/good times that happened on the train. Never before had performers been so well looked after and the train became a place for one hell of party - Buddy Guy says at one point he tried to sleep but was worried he might miss something - one car was for blues jamming, one for folk, one for food and one for, well, other activities. The whole event ran at a great loss, word on the street was that the concerts should be free and youth of the day would charge the gates causing trouble at every town. That is why this footage was not uncovered for more that 30 years, no one had any money at the end of it to produce the film and it just sat in a vault! Some split-screen technique is used combining contemporary interviews with original footage or simply showing the two points-of-view of a two camera shot. Performers featured are: “The Band”, “Delaney and Bonnie”, “The Flying Burrito Brothers”, “Grateful Dead”, “Buddy Guy Blues Band”, “Ian & Sylvia & The Great Speckled Bird”, “Janis Joplin”, “Mashmakhan” and “Sha Na Na”. Cities visited include Toronto, Winnipeg and Calgary (with a stop at a liquor store to re-stock!). Two disc set contains lots of extras.

results.title: Festival 78
results.creator_credit: Christopher Wade, Gil Cardinal and Access Alberta
results.brief_description: Festival 78 was the first cultural festival in Commonwealth history, and was held in conjunction with the XI Commonwealth Games in Edmonton, 1978. As an exchange of culture from all countries there was emphasis on national dancing, and many performances of all kinds took place throughout the city of Edmonton. Written and narrated by Dave Billington.

results.title: Field of dreams
results.creator_credit: Phil Alden Robinson, Charles Gordon, Lawrence Gordon and Gordon Company
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “Shoeless Joe” by W. P. Kinsella, this is the story of one man’s quest to transform vision to reality. “If you build it, he will come” is the ethereal message that inspires Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella (Kevin Costner) to construct a baseball diamond in the middle of his cornfield. At first “he” seems to be the ghost of disgraced ballplayer “Shoeless” Joe Jackson (Ray Liotta), who materialises on the ballfield and plays a few games with the awestruck Ray. However he gradually he comes to realise that his ballfield has been divinely ordained to give a second chance to people who have sacrificed certain valuable aspects of their lives, including a Salingeresque writer (James Earl Jones) and Doc Graham (Burt Lancaster), who gave up a promising career in baseball in favour of medicine. The film is a celebration of the love of baseball.

results.title: Fidelio
results.creator_credit: Pierre Jourdan, Stephane Tchalgadjieff and Daniele Gegauff
results.brief_description:
This performance of ‘Fidelio’, Beethoven’s only opera was recorded at the antique theatre of Orange (France). The ‘Philharmonic Orchestra of Israel’ is conducted by Zubin Mehta, with the ‘New Philharmonia’ choir of London. The stage direction is by Alfred Lipmann. The performance is introduced by an extract from ‘Napoleon et la Revolution’ directed by Abel Gance. ‘Fidelio’ was composed in reaction to the shattered hopes of the French Revolution and Napoleon’s encroaching grip over Europe. It is a classic love story in which liberty and justice triumph of oppression and tyranny thanks to the steely resolve of love.

Credits: Producers, Daniele Gegauff, Stephane Tchalgadjieff ; director, Pierre Jourdain ; photography, Michel Kelber.
Cast: Gundula Janovitz, Jon Vickers, Theo Adam.

results.title: Fearless: the Hunterwali story
results.creator_credit: Riyad Vinci Wadia and Wadia Movietone
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the life of Australian born actress Mary Evans who performed in numerous Indian films of the 1930s and 1940s under the alluring nom-de-plume Fearless Nadia. With her buxom physique, blonde hair and blue eyes Nadia’s roles typically showed her displaying incredible strength and fortitude in the face of marauding forces and wicked villains. Her roles included “Hunterwali” (1935), “Diamond Queen” (1940), “Jungle Princess” (1942), “Tigress” (1948) and “Jungle Queen” (1956), among others. Nadia challenged the traditionally submissive roles played by women in Indian cinema and performed many amazing and dangerous stunts required for the action and swashbuckling genres in which she extensively worked. J.B.H. Wadia (1901-86), a frequent collaborator of Nadia’s, became a master of adventure films as a successful director and producer along with his brother Homi. Features extensive interviews with Fearless Nadia reminiscing upon her life in the cinema; intrepid stuntman and actor John Cavas (aka Cawas) who worked extensively with Nadia; as well as several other Indian filmmaker contemporaries of Nadia. Numerous clips from Nadia’s oeuvre are shown alongside explanations of dangerous stunt work and co-ordination, and technical developments in cinema. With English subtitles.

constellations_other.name: Fearless women
constellations_other.description: Australian born Fearless Nadia would skyrocket to Bollywood fame in her first leading role as Princess Madhuri / the caped crusader herself Hunterwali. Translated in English as a Woman with a whip, Nadia delighted audiences with her daring stunts and circus skills.

results.title: Fearless: stories from Asian women
results.creator_credit: Peter Du Cane, Matthew Kelley, Samantha Kelley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary examines the experiences of four women fighting for social justice. Each is from a different culture but they are united by a refusal to remain silent and by their pursuit of human rights justice. Explosive devices tells the story of Doris Nuval, a former terrorist who is utilizing the power of television to bring justice to the Philippines. The Price of freedom outlays Bangladeshi writer Taslima Nasrins struggle against womens oppression and the forces of fundamentalism. Breaking the caste investigates Fathima Burnards aim to empower the Dalait women of India, thus changing a 3000 year old caste system. Heart on the sleeve Hien Tran is the voice for thousands of Australian outworkers who work for a pittance, under exploitative circumstances.

results.title: Fearless vampire killers or pardon me but your teeth are in my neck
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Gene Gutowski and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A mixture of parody, horror film and fairytale, this film about a kindly old fanatic and his incompetent young assistant who take on a castle of thirsty vampires armed only with cowardice, stupidity and a sharp stake, was described by Polanski as “a cartoon with people”. Although his film is at core voyeuristically heterosexual, Polanski makes the homoerotic aspect of the vampire film explicit. The high point is the macabrely beautiful great vampire ball. Cast includes Jack MacGowran, Sharon Tate, Alfie Bass, Ferdy Mayne, Terry Downes, Fiona Lewis, Iain Quarrier and Jessie Robbins.
